1353.79.text: And he's actually a Canine Good Citizen now.

1356.67.text:
He just passed that shortly before we were
done with school.

1359.37.text: So, that was a big thing for him.

1362.57.text:
>>Kelly Runyon:
You're a good citizen, Charlie.

1366.01.text: I think we're on the Chuck name basis now.

1367.11.text:
Well, Chelsea and Charlie, thank you so much
for joining us for this episode of the Paw

1373.17.text: Some good advice on pet first aid.

1409.17.text:
This Paw Report extra is definitely fitting
given the topic we just talked about.

1413.99.text:
A Wisconsin woman found her wedding ring that
she lost five years ago.

1419.33.text: It turned up in the most unusual way.

1426.78.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
Tucker is your typical mutt.

1429.39.text:
He likes playing with his frisbee and rolling
on the grass on a hot summer day.

1433.31.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
You wouldn't think he's 10 years old just

1435.98.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
Like every pup, he likes getting into trouble.

1438.62.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
He's known in the family to be the food burglar.

1441.87.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
And it's because of that nickname a secret

1445.00.text: hiding in his belly would be revealed.

1447.84.text:
Weeks ago, Lois Matykowski and her granddaughter
were eating popsicles outside.

1451.99.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
After I turn around, and I look at my granddaughter,

1456.68.text:
And there's Tucker, you know, smacking his
jaws.

1458.57.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
The food burglar had struck again, swallowing

1463.08.text: But the snatched food soon came back up.

1465.19.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
Stick and all, everything came out.

1466.64.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
Two days later, Tucker started vomiting again.

1469.43.text: Only this time, it wasn't a popsicle stick.

1472.15.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
And I look in the paper towel, and here is

1477.57.text: My wedding ring was in Tucker's puke!

1480.35.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
About five years ago, Matykowski says her

1483.93.text:
She searched the house high and low, with
no luck.

1488.21.text: How do you replace something like that?

1490.38.text:
Not only the value of the ring, but just the
emotional ties.

1493.99.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
Matykowski's veterinarian says the popsicle

1496.27.text: stick may have dislodged the ring inside Tucker.

1498.73.text:
And X-rays showed there are no more treasures
hidden in Tucker's belly, but Matykowski says

1503.20.text: Tucker is still the envy of the neighborhood.

1505.00.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
Friends have said, "I want a dog that throws

1509.38.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
And Tucker, she says he's taking it all in

1513.49.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
So, I have my wedding ring back, and Tucker

1514.85.text: is big dog on campus right now.

1519.21.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
Despite Tucker's crime as a jewel thief, Matykowski

1523.85.text:
>>Lois Matykowski:
I'm just elated that he threw up on the carpeting,

1527.34.text:
>>Rose Heaphy:
From now on, this pup will stick to doggie

1530.80.text: treats, and keep diamonds out of his diet.
